page.title: 03SETTLE CHURCH
page.content: Settle Church is 147 years old it was started in 1886 and was finished 2 years later. The first people to get married where Susannah Hardacre and Joseph Hartley on the 12th December 1894. They have services most days of the week. The youngest person to be buried in the church is Matthew Bulks aged 3 minutes old. The graveyard is used by all the local churches and is soon going to have to be extended. The bells in the tower are about 2-3 feet long but are no longer rung. People visit Settle Church because of the Welsh grave stone and the plaque in the doorway. The Welsh grave stone is there in memory of a Welsh person died who building the {Settle to Carlise line}and the plaque to remember the other people who died on the making of the line.
